channel.title: Updates: Peace Corps Resignations [Records Request]
channel.description: Updates on the Data Liberation Project's Peace Corps Resignations request

item.title: Records Published
item.author: The Data Liberation Project
item.description: On October 10, 2023, the Data Liberation Project published the records received through the appeal.

item.title: Appeal Granted
item.author: The Data Liberation Project
item.description: On August 11, 2023, the Peace Corps granted the Data Liberation Project’s appeal, “reversing our decision to withhold the information under FOIA exemption (b)(5).” Additionally, the agency wrote, “After reviewing your initial FOIA request and appeal, the Peace Corps conducted a second search of the Office of Strategic Information, Research, and Planning (OSIRP). As a result of this new search, we are providing you with a new, comprehensive Excel spreadsheet that contains the data elements for all resignations from the Peace Corps through July 31, 2023.”

item.title: Appeal Acknowledged
item.author: The Data Liberation Project
item.description: On July 14, 2023, the Peace Corps acknowledged our appeal, which has been assigned case number 23-0186.

item.title: Appeal Filed
item.author: The Data Liberation Project
item.description: On July 10, 2023, co-requestor Faife and the Data Liberation Project filed a letter appealing this request’s determination ðŸ“„, arguing that responsive records exist and were improperly withheld.

item.title: Non-responsive Records Provided
item.author: The Data Liberation Project
item.description: On May 2, 2023, the Peace Corps sent records ðŸ“„ it said were responsive to the first part of this request, along with a final response letter ðŸ“„ for that part. The records, however, were a spreadsheet of aggregated, redacted statistics, rather than the records requested.

item.title: Request Acknowledged, Placed In "Simple" Category, Fee Waiver Granted
item.author: The Data Liberation Project
item.description: On April 4, 2023, the Peace Corps sent an email acknowledging this request. The email indicates that the request has been placed in the “simple” category and that our fee waiver request has been granted.

item.title: Request Elaborated
item.author: The Data Liberation Project
item.description: On March 31, 2023, in response to our request submission, a Peace Corps information specialist asked if we’d like to modify the request to also cover system of records PC-17’s Volunteer Information Database Application (VIDA) and Peace Corps Volunteer Database Management System (PCVDBMS), which might contain the relevant records. We agreed; per the specialist, our confirmation via email was sufficient and there is no need to file a new request.
